standard_metadata.standard_description: Apply the properties of operations to generate equivalent expressions.

hints.content: We can play around with the expressions in the answer choices to see if they are the same as $x+x+x + 2$.
###Expression: $\blueD{3x+2}$  $ \begin{align} \blueD{3x + 2}  &\stackrel{?}{=} x+x+x + 2 \\\\ \blueD{3x + 2}   &\stackrel{\checkmark}{=} 3x +2   \end{align}$
###Expression: $\purpleD{3 + 2x} $  $ \begin{align} \purpleD{3 + 2x}  &\stackrel{?}{=} x+x+x + 2 \\\\ \purpleD{3 + 2x}   &\stackrel{?}{=}3x +2 \\\\ \purpleD{2x+3}   &\neq3x +2   \end{align}$
###Expression: $\greenD{3(x+2)} $  $ \begin{align} \greenD{3(x+2)}  &\stackrel{?}{=} x+x+x + 2 \\\\ \greenD{3(x+2)}   &\stackrel{?}{=}3x +2 \\\\ \greenD{3(x+2)}   &\neq3(x +\dfrac23)   \end{align}$

###Expression: $\goldD{2(x+1)+x} $  $ \begin{align} \goldD{2(x+1)+x}  &\stackrel{?}{=} x+x+x + 2 \\\\ \goldD{2(x+1)+x}    &\stackrel{?}{=}(x+x+2) + x  \\\\ \goldD{2(x+1)+x}   &\stackrel{\checkmark}{=}2(x+1)+x   \end{align}$
###Expression: $\maroonD{5x} $  $ \begin{align} \maroonD{5x}   &\stackrel{?}{=} x+x+x + 2 \\\\ \maroonD{5x}   &\neq3x +2   \end{align}$
The following expressions are equivalent to $x+x+x + 2$:  - $\blueD{3x + 2} $   - $\goldD{2(x+1)+x}   $
The fraction bar in $\dfrac{k}2$ can also represent division.
We can write $\dfrac{k}2$ and $k\div2$.

We can also write $\dfrac{k}2$ using multiplication:  $ \begin{align} \greenD{\dfrac12k}  &\stackrel{?}{=} \dfrac{k}2 \\\\ \greenD{\dfrac12k}   &\stackrel{?}{=}\dfrac{1k}{2} \\\\ \greenD{\dfrac12k}   &\stackrel{\checkmark}{=}\dfrac12k   \end{align}$
The following expressions are equivalent to $\dfrac{k}2$:  - $k\div2$   - $\dfrac12k $
We can play around with the expressions in the answer choices to see if they are the same as $4(4a+5)$.
###Expression: $\blueD{16a + 5}$  $ \begin{align} \blueD{16a + 5}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 4(4a+5)   \\\\ \blueD{16a + 5}  &\stackrel{?}{=} (4)4a+(4)5   \\\\ \blueD{16a + 5}   &\ne 16a+20   \end{align}$

###Expression: $\purpleD{16a+20}$  $ \begin{align} \purpleD{16a+20}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 4(4a+5)   \\\\ \purpleD{ 16a+20} &\stackrel{?}{=} (4)4a+(4)5    \\\\ \purpleD{16a+20}   &\stackrel{\checkmark}{=}16a+20    \end{align}$

###Expression: $\greenD{12a+20+4a}$     $ \begin{align} \greenD{12a+20+4a} &\stackrel{?}{=} 4(4a+5)   \\\\ \greenD{12a+20+4a}&\stackrel{?}{=}16a+20    \\\\ \greenD{12a+20+4a}&\stackrel{?}{=}12a+4a+20    \\\\ \greenD{12a+20+4a} &\stackrel{\checkmark}{=}12a+20 +4a\end{align}$

###Expression: $\goldD{2(8a+10)}$    $ \begin{align} \goldD{2(8a+10)} &\stackrel{?}{=} 4(4a+5)   \\\\ \goldD{2(8a+10)}&\stackrel{?}{=} 16a+20    \\\\ \goldD{2(8a+10)}  &\stackrel{\checkmark}{=}2(8a+10) \end{align}$

###Expression: $\maroonD{16a+5+4}$     $ \begin{align} \maroonD{16a+5+4} &\stackrel{?}{=} 4(4a+5)    \\\\ \maroonD{16a+5+4} &\stackrel{?}{=}16a+20    \\\\ \maroonD{16a+5+4}  &\neq16a+5+15 \end{align}$
The following expressions are equivalent to $4(4a+5)$:   -  $\purpleD{16a+20 }$ - $\greenD{12a+20+4a}$   - $\goldD{2(8a+10)}$
We can play around with the expressions in the answer choices to see if they are the same as $2(4f+2g)$.
###Expression: $\blueD{8f+2g}  $  $ \begin{align} \blueD{8f+2g}  &\stackrel{?}{=}  2(4f+2g)  \\\\ \blueD{8f+2g}  &\stackrel{?}{=}  (2)4f+(2)2g  \\\\ \blueD{8f+2g}   &\neq 8f+4g    \end{align}$

###Expression: $\purpleD{2f(4 + 2g)}$  $ \begin{align} \purpleD{2f(4 + 2g)}  &\stackrel{?}{=}  2(4f+2g)  \\\\ \purpleD{2f(4 + 2g)}  &\stackrel{?}{=}  (2)4f+(2)2g  \\\\ \purpleD{2f(4 + 2g)}  &\stackrel{?}{=}  8f+4g  \\\\ \purpleD{(2f)4 + (2f)2g}  &\stackrel{?}{=}  8f+4g  \\\\ \purpleD{8f+4fg}   &\neq 8f+4g    \end{align}$

###Expression: $\greenD{8f+4g} $  $ \begin{align} \greenD{8f+4g}  &\stackrel{?}{=}  2(4f+2g)  \\\\ \greenD{8f+4g}  &\stackrel{?}{=}  (2)4f+(2)2g  \\\\ \greenD{8f+4g}   &\stackrel{\checkmark}{=}  8f+4g   \end{align}$

###Expression: $\goldD{4(2f+g)}  $  $ \begin{align} \goldD{4(2f+g)}  &\stackrel{?}{=}  2(4f+2g)  \\\\ \goldD{4(2f+g)}  &\stackrel{?}{=}  (2)4f+(2)2g  \\\\ \goldD{4(2f+g)}  &\stackrel{?}{=}  8f+4g  \\\\ \goldD{4(2f+g)}  &\stackrel{\checkmark}{=}  4(2f+g)   \end{align}$

###Expression: $\maroonD{4f+4f+4g}$  $ \begin{align} \maroonD{4f+4f+4g} &\stackrel{?}{=}  2(4f+2g)  \\\\ \maroonD{4f+4f+4g}  &\stackrel{?}{=}  (2)4f+(2)2g  \\\\ \maroonD{4f+4f+4g} &\stackrel{?}{=}  8f+4g  \\\\ \maroonD{4f+4f+4g} &\stackrel{\checkmark}{=}  4f+4f+4g    \end{align}$
The following expressions are equivalent to $2(4f+2g)$:  - $\greenD{8f+4g} $  - $\goldD{4(2f+g)}  $ - $\maroonD{4f+4f+4g}$
We can play around with the expressions in the answer choices to see if they are the same as $z + (z + 6) $.

Let's see if the first expression is equivalent to $z + (z + 6) $.  $\qquad \begin{align} \blue{(z+z) + (z+6)}  &\stackrel{?}{=}  z + (z + 6)  \\\\ \blue{3z+6}  &\stackrel{?}{=}  z + (z + 6)  \\\\ \blue{3z+6}   &\neq  2z + 6 \\\\  \end{align}$

Let's see if the second expression is equivalent to $z + (z + 6) $.  $\qquad \begin{align} \purple{(z+6) + 6}  &\stackrel{?}{=}  z + (z + 6)  \\\\ \purple{z+12}  &\stackrel{?}{=}  z + (z + 6)  \\\\ \purple{z + 12}   &\neq  2z + 6 \\\\  \end{align}$

Let's see if the third expression is equivalent to $z + (z + 6) $.  $ \begin{align} \greenD{2(z+3)}  &\stackrel{?}{=}  z + (z + 6)  \\\\ \greenD{2z+6}  &\stackrel{?}{=}  z + (z + 6)  \\\\ \greenD{z+z+6}  &\stackrel{?}{=}  z + (z + 6)  \\\\ \greenD{z+(z+6)}  &\stackrel{\checkmark}{=}  z + (z + 6)   \end{align}$
$\greenD{2(z+3)}$ is equivalent to $z+(z+6)$.
We can play around with the expressions in the answer choices to see if they are the same as $4b$.

Let's see if the first expression is equivalent to $4b$.  $\qquad \begin{align} \blue{b+2(b+2b)}  &\stackrel{?}{=}  4b  \\\\ \blue{b+(2)b+(2)2b}   &\stackrel{?}{=} 4b  \\\\ \blue{b+2b+4b}   &\stackrel{?}{=} 4b  \\\\ \blue{7b}   &\neq4b  \\\\  \end{align}$
Let's see if the second expression is equivalent to $4b$.  $\qquad \begin{align} \purple{3b+b}  &\stackrel{?}{=}  4b  \\\\ \purple{4b}   &= 4b  \\\\  \end{align}$
Let's see if the third expression is equivalent to $4b$.  $ \begin{align} \greenD{2(2b)}  &\stackrel{?}{=}  4b  \\\\ \greenD{4b}   &= 4b   \end{align}$
The following expression is equivalent to $4b$:  - $\purple{  3b+b  } $   - $\greenD{2(2b)}$
We can play around with the expressions in the answer choices to see if they are the same as $3x+3(x+y)$.

Let's see if the first expression is equivalent to $3x+3(x+y)$.  $\qquad \begin{align} \blue{6x+3y}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 3x+3(x+y)   \\\\ \blue{6x+3y}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 3x+(3)x+(3)y   \\\\ \blue{6x+3y}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 3x+3x+3y   \\\\ \blue{6x + 3y}   &= 6x + 3y  \\\\  \end{align}$

Let's see if the second expression is equivalent to $3x+3(x+y)$.  $\qquad \begin{align} \purple{3(x+x+y)}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 3x+3(x+y)   \\\\ \purple{3(x+x+y)}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 3x+(3)x+(3)y   \\\\ \purple{3(x+x+y)}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 3x+3x+3y   \\\\ \purple{3(x+x+y)}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 6x + 3y   \\\\ \purple{(3)x+(3)x+(3)y}  &\stackrel{?}{=}6x + 3y  \\\\ \purple{3x+3x+3y}  &\stackrel{?}{=}6x + 3y  \\\\ \purple{6x + 3y }   &= 6x + 3y   \\\\  \end{align}$

Let's see if the third expression is equivalent to $3x+3(x+y)$.  $ \begin{align} \greenD{3xy}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 3x+3(x+y)   \\\\ \greenD{3\times x\times y}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 3x+3(x+y)   \\\\ \greenD{3\times x\times y}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 3x+3x+3y   \\\\ \greenD{3\times x\times y}    &\neq3(x+x+y)   \end{align}$
The following expressions are equivalent to $3x+3(x+y)$:  - $\blue{ 6x+3y  } $    -  $\purple{3(x+x+y)}$
We can play around with the expressions in the answer choices to see if they are the same as $2(b+3c)$.

Let's see if the first expression is equivalent to $2(b+3c)$.  $\qquad \begin{align} \blue{3(b+2c)}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 2(b+3c)   \\\\ \blue{3(b+2c)}  &\stackrel{?}{=} (2)b+(2)3c   \\\\ \blue{3(b+2c)}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 2b+6c   \\\\ \blue{(3)b+(3)2c}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 2b+6c   \\\\ \blue{3b + 6c}   &\ne 2b + 6c  \\\\  \end{align}$

Let's see if the second expression is equivalent to $2(b+3c)$.  $\qquad \begin{align} \purple{(b+3c)+(b+3c)}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 2(b+3c)   \\\\ \purple{(b+3c)+(b+3c)}  &\stackrel{?}{=}  (2)b+(2)3c    \\\\ \purple{(b+3c)+(b+3c)}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 2b+6c  \\\\ \purple{b+3c+b+3c}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 2b+6c \\\\ \purple{2b + 6c}   &= 2b+6c  \\\\  \end{align}$
Let's see if the third expression is equivalent to $2(b+3c)$.  $ \begin{align} \greenD{2(b)+2(3c)} &\stackrel{?}{=} 2(b+3c)   \\\\ \greenD{2(b)+2(3c)} &= 2(b)+2(3c)     \end{align}$
The following expressions are equivalent to $2(b+3c)$:   -  $\purple{(b+3c)+(b+3c) }$ - $\greenD{2(b)+2(3c)}$
We can play around with the expressions in the answer choices to see if they are the same as $4d+6+2d$.

Let's see if the first expression is equivalent to $4d+6+2d$.  $\qquad \begin{align} \blue{2(3d+3)}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 4d+6+2d   \\\\ \blue{2(3d+3)}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 6d+6   \\\\ \blue{(2)3d+(2)3}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 6d+6  \\\\ \blue{6d+6}   &= 6d+6 \\\\  \end{align}$

Let's see if the second expression is equivalent to $4d+6+2d$.  $\qquad \begin{align} \purple{6(d+6)}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 4d+6+2d   \\\\ \purple{6(d+6)}  &\stackrel{?}{=}6d+6  \\\\ \purple{(6)d + (6)6}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 6d+6  \\\\ \purple{6d + 36}   &\ne 6d+6  \\\\  \end{align}$

Let's see if the third expression is equivalent to $4d+6+2d$.  $ \begin{align} \greenD{(3d+3)+(3d+3)}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 4d+6+2d   \\\\ \greenD{(3d+3)+(3d+3)}   &\stackrel{?}{=} 6d+6   \\\\ \greenD{(3d+3)+(3d+3)}   &\stackrel{?}{=} 2(3d+3)  \\\\ \greenD{(3d+3)+(3d+3)}   &= (3d+3) +(3d+3)   \end{align}$
The following expression is equivalent to $4d+6+2d$:  - $\blue{ 2(3d+3)  } $   - $\greenD{(3d+3)+(3d+3)} $
We can play around with the expressions in the answer choices to see if they are the same as $x + 2y + x + 2$.

Let's see if the first expression is equivalent to $x + 2y + x + 2$.  $ \begin{align} \blue{2(x+y+1)}  &\stackrel{?}{=}  x + 2y + x + 2  \\\\ \blue{(2)x+(2)y+(2)1}   &\stackrel{?}{=} x + 2y + x + 2  \\\\ \blue{2x+2y+2}   &\stackrel{?}{=} x + 2y + x + 2  \\\\ \blue{2x+2y+2}   &= 2x + 2y  + 2    \end{align}$
Let's see if the second expression is equivalent to $x + 2y + x + 2$.  $ \begin{align} \purple{2x + 4y +4}  &\stackrel{?}{=}  x + 2y + x + 2  \\\\ \purple{2x+4y+4}   &\neq 2x + 2y + 2    \end{align}$
The following expression is equivalent to $x + 2y + x + 2$:  - $\blue{ 2(x+y+1)   } $
We can play around with the expressions in the answer choices to see if they are the same as $q+p+q+p+q$.
Let's see if the first expression is equivalent to $q+p+q+p+q$.  $\qquad \begin{align} \\\\ \blue{2p + 3q}  &\stackrel{?}{=} q+p+q+p+q   \\\\ \blue{2p + 3q}   &= 2p + 3q  \\\\  \end{align}$

Let's see if the second expression is equivalent to $q+p+q+p+q$.  $\qquad \begin{align} \purple{2(p+q) + q}  &\stackrel{?}{=} q+p+q+p+q   \\\\ \purple{2(p+q) + q}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 2p + 3q   \\\\ \purple{(2)p+(2)q + q}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 2p + 3q  \\\\ \purple{2p+2q + q}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 2p + 3q  \\\\ \purple{2p + 3q}   &= 2p + 3q  \\\\  \end{align}$
The following expressions are equivalent to $q+p+q+p+q$:  - $\blue{ 2p + 3q   } $    -  $\purple{2(p+q) + q }$
We can play around with the expressions in the answer choices to see if they are the same as $2r + (t + r) $.

Let's see if the first expression is equivalent to $2r + (t + r) $.  $\qquad \begin{align} \blue{2rt + 4r}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 2r + (t + r)   \\\\ \blue{2rt + 4r}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 2r + t + r   \\\\ \blue{2rt + 4r}   &\neq 3r + t   \\\\  \end{align}$

Let's see if the second expression is equivalent to $2r + (t + r) $.  $\qquad \begin{align} \purple{r+t}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 2r + (t + r)   \\\\ \purple{r+t}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 2r + t + r   \\\\ \purple{r+t}   &\neq 3r + t   \\\\  \end{align}$
"None of the above" is the correct answer.
We can play around with the expressions in the answer choices to see if they are the same as $3(4h+2k)$.
Let's see if the first expression is equivalent to $3(4h+2k)$.  $\qquad \begin{align} \\\\ \blue{3(2k+4h)}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 3(4h+2k)   \\\\ \blue{3(4h+2k)}   &=  3(4h+2k) \\\\  \end{align}$

Let's see if the second expression is equivalent to $3(4h+2k)$.  $\qquad \begin{align} \purple{3(4k+2h)}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 3(4h+2k)   \\\\ \purple{3(4k+2h)}  &\stackrel{?}{=} (3)4h+(3)2k   \\\\ \purple{3(4k+2h)}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 12h+6k   \\\\ \purple{(3)4k+(3)2h}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 12h+6k   \\\\ \purple{12k+6h}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 12h+6k   \\\\ \purple{6h+12k}   &\neq  12h+6k \\\\  \end{align}$
The following expression is equivalent to $3(4h+2k)$:  - $\blue{ 3(2k+4h)   } $
We can play around with the expressions in the answer choices to see if they are the same as $j+j+2k$.
Let's see if the first expression is equivalent to $j+j+2k$.  $\qquad \begin{align} \blue{2jk}  &\stackrel{?}{=} j+j+2k   \\\\ \blue{2jk}   &\ne 2j + 2k  \\\\  \end{align}$

Let's see if the second expression is equivalent to $j+j+2k$.  $\qquad \begin{align} \purple{2(j+j+k)}  &\stackrel{?}{=} j+j+2k   \\\\ \purple{2(j+j+k)}  &\stackrel{?}{=}  2j+2k   \\\\ \purple{(2)j+(2)j+(2)k}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 2j+2k  \\\\ \purple{2j+2j+2k}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 2j+2k  \\\\ \purple{4j+2k}   &\ne 2j+2k  \\\\  \end{align}$
"None of the above" is the correct answer.
We can play around with the expressions in the answer choices to see if they are the same as $(5g+3h+4)\cdot2$.

Let's see if the first expression is equivalent to $(5g+3h+4)\cdot2$.  $\qquad \begin{align} \blue{(5g+3h)\cdot8}  &\stackrel{?}{=} (5g+3h+4)\cdot2   \\\\ \blue{(5g+3h)\cdot8}  &\stackrel{?}{=} (2)5g+(2)3h+(2)4   \\\\ \blue{(5g+3h)\cdot8}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 10g+6h+8   \\\\ \blue{(8)5g+(8)3h}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 10g+6h+8   \\\\ \blue{40g + 24h}   &\ne 10g+6h+8   \\\\  \end{align}$

Let's see if the second expression is equivalent to $(5g+3h+4)\cdot2$.  $\qquad \begin{align} \purple{(5g+3h)\cdot6}  &\stackrel{?}{=} (5g+3h+4)\cdot2   \\\\ \purple{(5g+3h)\cdot6}  &\stackrel{?}{=} (2)5g+(2)3h+(2)4   \\\\ \purple{(5g+3h)\cdot6}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 10g+6h+8  \\\\ \purple{(6)5g+(6)3h}  &\stackrel{?}{=} 10g+6h+8  \\\\ \purple{30g + 18h}   &\ne 10g+6h+8  \\\\  \end{align}$
"None of the above" is the correct answer.
